entry.def: You use someone or somebody to refer to a person without saying exactly who you mean.

example.ex: Her father was shot by someone trying to rob his small retail store...
example.tran: 她的父亲被企图抢劫他那间小零售店的人开枪打死了。

example.ex: I need someone to help me...

entry.def: If you say that a person is someone or somebody in a particular kind of work or in a particular place, you mean that they are considered to be important in that kind of work or in that place.
entry.tran: (某行业或某地方的)重要人物，大人物

example.ex: He was somebody in the law division...
example.tran: 他在法律部门是个人物。

example.ex: 'Before she came around,' she says, 'I was somebody in this town'.
example.tran: “她来之前，”她说道，“我在这个镇上也算得上个人物了。”

Sentence.sentence: Studying at university will only become less attractive if employers shift their focus away from where someone went to university--and there is no sign of that happening anytime soon.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Intimacy is the feeling of closeness, of connectedness with someone, of bonding.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When these students encounter a new problem of the same type on a test, they're able to transfer the knowledge they've gathered more effectively than those who were the passive recipients of someone else's expertise.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: According to a multiethnic study of Los Angeles adolescents, teenagers who said that their role model was someone they knew, e.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I'm not someone who's anti-technology, but I'm always worried that technology becomes an end in and of itself, and it replaces teaching or it replaces analysis
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And once you're home, recovering, Ava could let you talk to your doctor, so there's no need to send someone to your house.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Waiting for someone at the airport
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: If someone has a great sense of humor, were a son, it means that they are happy, socially confident and have a healthy perspective on life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When these people ran up against a technical problem, to which they'd have to turn to someone else for an answer, they'd e-mail and get an answer right away, because they built up a network of people before they needed them
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The difference occurs when someone needs to drink
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He will send someone right away.

Sentence.sentence: Chris knows, however, that someone else wants that new job, too.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Even if I am on vacation in the mountains, I am eating food someone else has grown, living in a house someone else has built, wearing clothes someone else has sewn from cloth woven by others, using electricity someone else is distributing to my house.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I hope you are not to put out with me for the delay ,I had to stop for the Fred's home to pick up a book on my way here M : well , that's not a big deal ,but you might at least phone if you know you will keep someone waiting Q : what do we learn about the women
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: You know, all those old films where someone gets so outraged with his boss, He picks up a custard pie and plasters it all over the other person's face

Sentence.sentence: Why do many people find it funny to see someone throwing a custard pie on their boss's face?
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Maybe so, but someone managed to get that hand gun onto the aircraft or it couldn't have been there
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Someone once said that there's a bit of ice at the heart of every writer.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: As he prepared the speech, Juan kept asking himself, "How can I make this clear and meaningful to someone who knows nothing about earthquakes or geological principles?
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "Everybody has a scary story about someone getting scooped." says New York University astronomer David Hogg.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: And, for someone always on-the-go who may not have time for a meal, a protein snack bar can be a good option for occasional meal replacement.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: But decision fatigue goes away when you are making the decision for someone else.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: But there's still someone who deserves scrutiny—the person holding the phone.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Each day of Kwanzaa, usually before the evening meal, family and friends gather around the table and someone lights a candle, beginning with the black.

Sentence.sentence: From now on, when someone asks you how your life is, try responding with words like "exciting" and "fun", instead of the culture norm that says "busy".
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Have you ever had someone try to explain something to you a dozen times with no luck?
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Her time-lapse videos of the revivals look like someone playing a tape of the plant's death in reverse.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: However, if a 1916 piece by her great-niece is to be trusted, Hale claimed for the  rest of her life that "some other people pretended that someone else wrote the poem".
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: It is as if there is something fun and liberating about making someone else's choice.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Many people assume that our attitudes are internally consistent, that is, the way you think and feel about someone or something predicts your behavior towards them.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Now, a company in Massachusetts says that by using magnetic brain scans, they can determine with 97% accuracy whether someone is telling the truth.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Our own decision-making abilities can become depleted over the course of the day causing indecision or poor choices, but choosing on behalf of someone else is an enjoyable task that doesn't suffer the same pitfalls.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps you're bringing your unique knowledge and gaining access to someone else's professional network, or Maybe you're able to learn a new skill by working with someone.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Psychologists call them "masters of deception", those rare individuals with a natural ability to tell, with complete confidence, when someone is telling a lie.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Research shows that when we absorb information in order to teach it to someone else, we learn it more accurately and deeply, perhaps in part because we are engaging our social cognition.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: since the middle of the 20th century, though, things have turned the opposite way—these days, punishing hours at your desk, rather than days off, are seen as the mark of someone important.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Some experts even consider lying a developmental milestone, like crawling and walking, because it requires sophisticated planning, attention and the ability to see a situation from someone else5 s perspective to manipulate them.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Studying at university will only become less attractive if employers shift their focus away from where someone went to university—and there is no sign of that happening anytime soon.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: When people imagine themselves as advisers and imagine their own choices as belonging to someone else, they feel less tired and rely less on decision shortcuts to make those choices.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

sentences.sentence: "there was too much for one person to do"

stems_affixes.word_buile: lone[adj.孤独的, 独立的]+ly表形容词→adj.孤独的,寂寞的
one一+ly表形容词→adj.唯一的, 单独的
lonely孤独的,寂寞的+ness表名词→n.孤独, 寂寞

stems_affixes.value_cn: 一次, 从前, 曾经

Sentence.sentence: Next time you talk with someone who takes a stand, ask them to give you a reason for their view.

Sentence.sentence: Snap decisions can be important defense mechanisms; if we are judging whether someone is dangerous, our brains and bodies are hard-wired to react very quickly, within milliseconds.

Sentence.sentence: So when someone tries to communicate with you, just be in that communication wholeheartedly.

sentences.en: I'll ask them to send someone out straightaway to fix the car.

sentences.cn: 她把别人的书错当成自己的书拿走了.
sentences.en: She took someone else's book in mistake for her own.

sentences.cn: 对不起,我得挂电话了, 有人敲门.
sentences.en: I am sorry I have to hang up now. Someone is knocking at the door.

sentences.en: Someone has been listening in to our telephone conversation.

sentences.en: Since someone has to go anyway, let me go.

sentences.en: Someone has flown off with my blue bag.

sentences.en: Someone wants to see her.

sentences.en: Suddenly he heard a rustle in the peony pavilion and someone sighing deeply.

sentences.cn: 你一定被认识你的人见到过.
sentences.en: You are pretty certain to be seen by someone who knows you.

sentences.cn: 这就像一个英国政府滑稽剧:我被从一个部门打发到另一个部门,每个人都说帮助我是他人的事.
sentences.en: It was like a Whitehall farce the way I was sent from department to department and everyone said it was someone else's job to help me.

sentences.cn: 要像评价别人的工作一样,一丝不苟地检查你自己的工作.
sentences.en: Critically examine your work as if you were looking at someone else's efforts.

sentences.cn: 她一直坐到有人同意帮忙了才了事.
sentences.en: She sat on until someone agreed to help.

sentences.cn: 每当别人提起这个话题, 他就将话题引开.
sentences.en: Whenever someone else raised the subject, he would pass it off.

sentences.en: Someone knocked on the door, so I went to answer it.

sentences.en: The criminal knew that he could not talk to the police about his friends; if he did, someone would stop his breath.

sentences.cn: 当他发现她爱别人的时候,他吃醋了.
sentences.en: He was jealous when he discovered that she loved someone else.

sentences.cn: 门边正有人在竭力听着什么.
sentences.en: There is someone straining his ears at the door.

sentences.en: To accurately tell whether someone is sociable, studies show, we need at least a minute, preferably five.

sentences.cn: 亲密关系是一种亲近的感觉，是与某人建立的一种相互联系，一种情感纽带。
sentences.en: Intimacy is the feeling of closeness, of  connectedness  with  someone,  of  bonding.

sentences.cn: 不管什么时候，只要她想给父母或其他亲戚打电话，她总得考虑时差，这样才不至于吵醒某人或者在他们去教堂的时候把电话打过去。
sentences.en: Whenever she called her parents or other relatives, she always had to think about the time difference so that she?wouldn’t wake someone up or call when she knew they were at church.

sentences.cn: 你说服某人了 吗 ?
sentences.en: Did you persuade someone of something?

sentences.cn: 告诉某人发生的事.
sentences.en: To tell someone what have happen.

sentences.cn: 如果某人的生活超过了他们的所想,那么就是指他花的钱比他挣的钱或者他所能承受的要多.
sentences.en: If someone lives beyond their means they spend more money than they earn or can afford.

sentences.cn: 是愿意半路遇见某人.
sentences.en: Being willing to meet someone halfway.

sentences.cn: 本质上, 这是另外一种告诉某人他所说的话是正确的方式.
sentences.en: Essentially, this is another way to tell someone that what they have said sounds right.

sentences.cn: 遇见某人, 堕入情网, 然后幸福的生活.
sentences.en: Meet someone, fall in love, live ever after.

sentences.cn: 胡闹剧中通常可见到某人的脸上被牛奶蛋糊馅饼砸个正著.
sentences.en: A slapstick scene usually includes someone being hit in the face with a custard pie.

sentences.cn: 扼死: 使某人或某动物停止呼吸.
sentences.en: Strangling: to stop someone or something breathing.

sentences.cn: 你不能令某人爱你.
sentences.en: You can't make someone love you.

sentences.cn: 说某人能做某事.
sentences.en: To say that someone can do something.

sentences.cn: 当欢迎某人时,你可能倾向于低头看或转移目光.
sentences.en: You may tend to look down or away when greeting someone.

sentences.cn: 礼物使某人很惊讶.
sentences.en: I surprise someone with a gift.

sentences.cn: 作为名词, 爱的定义是一种喜爱或渴望某人的感觉.
sentences.en: As a noun, love is defined as a feeling of affection or desire for someone.

sentences.cn: 你可曾有过这种情况,某人的话会猛烈地冲击着你?
sentences.en: Did you ever have something that someone said hit you like a ton of bricks?

sentences.cn: 你正与某人保持交往 吗 ?
sentences.en: Are you going steady with someone?

sentences.cn: 错误扣押某人的侵权行为.
sentences.en: Tort of keeping someone imprison wrongfully.

sentences.cn: 志贵祈祷让某人来把他们从这地狱里解放出去.
sentences.en: Shiki prays for someone to release them from this hell.

sentences.cn: 说某人错是容易做到的.
sentences.en: Saying someone is wrong is easy.

sentences.cn: 我跟上某人.
sentences.en: I catch up with someone.

sentences.cn: 你不知道的某人对你存有爱意.
sentences.en: Someone that you don't even know exists loves you.

sentences.cn: 我和某人唱二重唱.
sentences.en: I sing with someone in duet.

sentences.cn: 你可以使用名词词组说出它们的名称以此来提及某人或某事.
sentences.en: You can use a noun group to refer to someone or something by naming them.

sentences.cn: 有人把包落下了。
sentences.en: Someone's left their bag behind.

sentences.cn: 我需要有人帮忙。
sentences.en: I need someone to help me...

sentences.cn: 假设你正和某个陌生人共处一室，你心里有个声音说“我想和这个人交谈”——这在我们所有人身上大概都会发生
sentences.en: Suppose you are in a room with someone you don't know and something within you says" I want to talk with this person”—this is something the mostly happens with all of us.

sentences.cn: 愤怒警示我们有人正在触犯我们、行为越界或违背信任。
sentences.en: Angry feelings warn us that someone is stepping on our toes, crossing a boundary or violating our trust

sentences.en: Someone was taking photos and most people would grip together and smile.

sentences.en: Isn't it annoying having someone looking over your shoulder while you program?

sentences.cn: 我前几天无意中听到有人说我阴沉、不可捉摸.
sentences.en: I overheard someone the other day saying that I was moody and unpredictable.

sentences.cn: 我们将战斗, 但不是出于泄恨, 而是因为必须有人站出来支持真理.
sentences.en: We'll fight, not out of spite, for someone must stand up for what's right.

sentences.cn: 我听到有人在窗外徘徊.

sentences.en: I felt someone patting me on the shoulder from behind.

sentences.cn: 我们需要有人来修理录音机.
sentences.en: We needed someone to fix the tape recorder.

sentences.cn: 这家人都穿着凶服,一定是有人去世了.
sentences.en: This family are all wearing the mourning apparel. Someone must have died.

sentences.cn: 所有人都不喜欢的事情是与一个心不在焉的人谈话.
sentences.en: The last thing anyone wants is to have a conversation with someone who isn't there.

sentences.cn: 正义是一台机器, 一旦有人推一下就会自己转下去.
sentences.en: Justice is a machine that, when someone has given it a starting push, rolls on itself.

sentences.cn: 没有人能代替他,然而必须有人继承他.
sentences.en: No one could replace him but someone had to succeed him.

sentences.cn: 例如，他提出这样一种理论：一名法官因为担心在犯罪面前表现得太心慈手软，如果一天当中已经宣判其他五、六名被告人执行强制性的社区服务，那么他就极有可能把某个人送进监狱。
sentences.en: For example, he theorised that a judge fearful of appearing too soft on crime might be more likely to send someone to prison if he had already sentenced five or six other defendants only to forced community service on that day.

sentences.cn: 如果她不喜欢某个人, 也毫不掩饰自己的想法.
sentences.en: If she takes against someone, she makes no attempt at pretence.

sentences.cn: 即便是现在, 某个地方的某个人还在写着《资本主义的终结》(TheEndofCapitalism).
sentences.en: Even now, someone somewhere penning The End of Capitalism.

sentences.en: Never point a gun at someone, even in fun, as it might be loaded.

sentences.en: It's usually used to describe a TV show, movie, or something someone says.

sentences.en: It describes when someone accepts responsibility to act in the interests of a child.

sentences.en: My good opinion of someone once lost is lost for ever.

sentences.en: Don't let the erratic behavior of someone you live with interfere with your professional performance.

sentences.en: You want someone not to touch something?

sentences.en: Find someone, opened a knot, recovered a lost love that will never.

sentences.en: Be modest when trying to impress someone, there's a big temptation to brag.

sentences.en: But when I'm very interested in someone, it's much more in depth.

sentences.cn: 想要杀人, 和想要杀某个人,是有区别的.
sentences.en: There's a difference between wanting to murder, and wanting to murder someone.

Sentence.sentence: Whenever she called her parents or other relatives, she always had to think about the time difference so that she wouldn’t wake someone up or call when she knew they were at church.

Sentence.sentence: But how probable is it that someone will successfully jam their way into your home and steal your stuff?Let's imagine that you live in a small home with a wireless security setup that offers a functional anti-jamming system.
